jparsec.io.image

Class ImageSplineTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.image.ImageSplineTransform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ImageSplineTransform
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Spline interpolation in 2D applied to rotate or resample images, based on two different routines by Philippe Thévenaz and A. Muñoz Barrutia et al. Basic implementation of Thévenaz method is taken from SkyView. The implementation by Thévenaz is not as good as the other, and it is used to interpolate within the array representing an image. The second method by Muñoz Barrutia et al. is better, and it is used to change the size of the image.

    P. Thévenaz, T. Blu, M. Unser, "Interpolation Revisited," IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging, vol. 19, no. 7, pp. 739-758, July 2000.
    A. Muñoz Barrutia, T. Blu, M. Unser, "Least-Squares Image Resizing Using Finite Differences," IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, vol. 10, no. 9, pp. 1365-1378, September 2001.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • fastBilinearInterpolation

        public double fastBilinearInterpolation(double x,
                               double y)
                                 throws JPARSECException
        Interpolate at a given position using a fast bilinear algorithm. Image must be a 2x2 image at least.
        Parameters:
        x - X index position in the image, from 0 to width-1.
        y - Y index position in the image, from 0 to height-1.
        Returns:
        Interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the point is outside the image.

      • interpolate

        public double interpolate(double px,
                 double py)
                   throws JPARSECException
        Interpolate at a given position. If you entered the image as a column array of size [1][y] set px = 0 to interpolate.
        Parameters:
        px - X index position in the image, from 0 to width-1.
        py - Y index position in the image, from 0 to height-1.
        Returns:
        Interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the point is outside the image.

        Parameters:

        y0 - Y position of new center.

      • resize

        public void resize(int w,
          int h)
            throws JPARSECException
        Resizes the image to another size using the method Least-Squares Image Resizing Using Finite Differences. This method is faster and more accurate than the method using spline interpolation.

        A. Muñoz Barrutia, T. Blu, M. Unser, "Least-Squares Image Resizing Using Finite Differences," IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, vol. 10, no. 9, pp. 1365-1378, September 2001.

        Parameters:
        w - New width.
        h - New height.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getResizedData

        public double[][] getResizedData(int w,
                        int h)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Resizes the image data to another size using the method Least-Squares Image Resizing Using Finite Differences. This method is faster and more accurate than the method using spline interpolation.

        A. Muñoz Barrutia, T. Blu, M. Unser, "Least-Squares Image Resizing Using Finite Differences," IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, vol. 10, no. 9, pp. 1365-1378, September 2001.

        Parameters:
        w - New width.
        h - New height.
        Returns:
        The image data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • resize

        public void resize(int w,
          int h,
          int quality)
        Resizes the image to another size using P. Thévenaz interpolation. This method is generally slower and less accurate, but sometimes (when resizing to very little sizes) can be better than the one using finite differences.
        Parameters:
        w - New width.
        h - New height.
        quality - A quality value to set the quality of the resize. Should be and odd number equal or greater than 1. The greater the value the slower the resizing process will be.

      • getResizedData

        public double[][] getResizedData(int w,
                        int h,
                        int quality)
        Resizes the image data to another size using P. Thévenaz interpolation. This method is generally slower and less accurate, but sometimes (when resizing to very little sizes) can be better than the one using finite differences.
        Parameters:
        w - New width.
        h - New height.
        quality - A quality value to set the quality of the resize. Should be and odd number equal or greater than 1. The greater the value the slower the resizing process will be.
        Returns:
        The image data.

        args - Not used.
